DataElement.preferredName: Growth Factor Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the administration of substances made by the body that function to regulate cell division and cell survival as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Growth Factor Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Substances made by the body that function to regulate cell division and cell survival. Some growth factors are also produced in the laboratory and used in biological therapy._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Substances made by the body that function to regulate cell division and cell survival. Some growth factors are also produced in the laboratory and used in biological therapy.

Concepts.definition: Growth Factors are extracellular signaling molecules (ligands) involved in control of target cell proliferation, cell survival, and cell differentiation. (NCI)

Property.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient require chronic
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require chronic maintenance of white blood cell counts or granulocyte counts through the use of growth factor support (e.g. Neulasta®, Neupogen®)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving growth factors (granulocyte colony stimulating factor or granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor) at the time of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received colony stimulating factors (e.g., granulocyte colony-stimulating factor, granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor or recombinant erythropoietin) within 3 weeks before initiation of protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 7 days elapsed since the completion of therapy with a growth factor and at least 14 days have elapsed after receiving pegfilgrastim prior to leukapheresis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients undergoing leukapheresis:  Prior to leukapheresis have at least 7 days elapsed since the completion of therapy with a growth factor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 7 days elapsed since the completion of therapy with a growth factor and at least 14 days must have elapsed after receiving pegfilgrastim?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient previously had hematopoietic growth factor agents as a treatment?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.2 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002682. ak
